overview: From 2025-09-16 to 2025-09-17, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 10 new PRs (5 merged), 7 new issues, and 28 active contributors.

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add acceptance tests
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
Requires https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/specs/issues/742.

These tests should exercise activating the feature both at genesis and on a live chain. 

Fuzzing should be considered where appropriate, to exercise different relationships between fees (such as the base fee being greater/less than the priority fee etc).

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: load minimum base fee value from SystemConfig contract events
topIssues.author: geoknee

topIssues.title: Update withdrawal op-chain-ops command for U16a
topIssues.author: pauldowman

topIssues.title: op-batcher: prepare for Fusaka
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
When Fusaka activates on L1, the batcher needs to behave differently. 

It needs to send blob transactions with _cell proofs_ rather than _blob_ proofs. See [this doc for more info](https://www.notion.so/oplabs/Fusaka-Blob-Tx-Offchain-compatibility-26bf153ee1628013bb54dccdca75ccbc). We should bring in code from upstream geth to support this, we may need to bake it in if it gets removed from upstream geth.

We probably need to coordinate activating the new behaviour with Fusaka activation (cell proofs unlikely to work before Fusaka). 

For a v0, we should just add a CLI flag to control the type of transaction used. This allows us to successfully defend Fusaka by having chain operators restart their batcher close to Fusaka activation with the new behavior enabled. 


We also need to consider [EIP 7825,](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7825):  what if calldata batches use too much gas? Also, the intrinsic costs change, which could affect the minimum.

topIssues.title: op-acceptance-test: add back op-reth to jovian kt-devnet
topIssues.author: wlawt
topIssues.body:
Right now op-reth doesn't have the min base fee. So this issue is created to track that once op-reth is updated then we can add back the image to the yaml file.

Context: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17441#discussion_r2352622905

topPRs.title: feat: introduce configurable min basefee
topPRs.author: wlawt
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

From: https://github.com/wlawt/optimism/pull/10

**Description**

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

This PR lets the rollup [configure the minimum base fee](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/blob/main/protocol/minimum-base-fee.md) via `SystemConfig`.


**Tests**

<!--
Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.
-->

- Expanded test coverage for existing unit tests that referenced Holocene/EIP1559Params
- Added acceptance tests: `op-acceptance-tests/tests/jovian/min_base_fee_test.go`
- Added fork tests:
   - `op-e2e/actions/proofs/jovian_activation_test.go`
   - `op-e2e/actions/upgrades/jovian_fork_test.go`
- Added e2e tests:
    - `op-e2e/system/fees/minbasefee_test.go`

**Additional context**

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

**Metadata**

<!-- 
Include a link to any github issues that this may close in the following form:
- Fixes #[Link to Issue]
-->


TODO:
- [x] Add acceptance tests
- [x] Add op-e2e/actions/upgrades/ for jovian

topPRs.title: feat: add tests for min-base-fee
topPRs.author: wlawt
topPRs.body:
From: #16852 

Minimal changes to get e2e and acceptance-tests working

Progress:
- `op-e2e/actions/proofs/jovian_activation_test.go` passes
- `just acceptance-test "" jovian` passes 
- `just acceptance-test "" base` passes
- `just acceptance-test simple jovian` now compiles & passes

Notes:
- `TestMinBaseFee` takes longer than the rest of the tests to run on sysgo: 2m32.358s
- For sysext is takes: 4m28.336174s

completedItems.title: feat(ci): parallelise go-tests jobs
completedItems.body:
## Description
Parallelised the "go-test" CI job across multiple machines (8). By doing so I expect these jobs to:
1. Run faster
2. Be more reliable/robust (each machine won't have as much load)
3. (Hopefully) Assist with our debugging

completedItems.title: fix: bug blocking op-deployer verify
completedItems.body: Fixes some bugs in op-deployer's verify command. Also fixes a few issues with the contracts that causes the deployer to struggle to properly verify things.
